name: AWS VPC Subnets nearing availability limit
description:
This policy identifies VPCs which are nearing availability limit of subnets. AWS provides a reasonable starting limitation for the maximum number of VPC subnets you can assign in each VPC. If you approach the limit in a particular VPC, you have nearly exhausted your allocation. As a best practice, it is recommended to remove Subnets that are not associated or not used, it will also help you avoid unexpected charges on your bill.
NOTE: As per https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/amazon-vpc-limits.html. On the date, Subnets per VPC limit is 200. This policy will trigger an alert if Subnets per VPC reached 80% (i.e. 160) of resource availability limit allocated. If you need more Subnets in a VPC, You can contact AWS for a service limit increase.
searchModel.query: config from cloud.resource where cloud.type = 'aws' AND api.name = 'aws-ec2-describe-vpcs' AND json.rule = 'subnetCount > 160'
recommendation:
1. Sign into the AWS console
2. In the console, select the specific region from region drop down on the top right corner, for which the alert is generated
3. Navigate to VPC Dashboard
4. Click on 'Subnets' (Left Panel)
5. Choose the Subnets you want to delete, which is no more used or required
6. Click on 'Actions' dropdown
7. Click on 'Delete Subnets'
8. On 'Delete subnet' popup dialog, Click on 'Delete subnet'
NOTE: If existing Subnets are properly associated and exhausted your VPC Subnets limit allocation, you can contact AWS for a service limit increase.
